captions.text: When Yuan Yuan first starts caring for Yuan Zai
She holds Yuan Zai constantly, even if she grows tired
When her daughter calls out
she hugs Yuan Zai tightly
Sometimes the exhausted Yuan Yuan would begin to doze off
She can feel her eyelids become heavy and begin to droop
but she refuses to close her eyes
If Yuan Zai makes any movement in her sleep
She immediately holds her closer
Now that Yuan Yuan and Yuan Zai have been reunited for a few days
Yuan Yuan is starting to understand Yuan Zai's different cries and needs better
She can finally nap with Yuan Zai peacefully
Besides wanting to eat or defecate,
Yuan Zai spends the remainder of her time sleeping
Sometimes Yuan Zai lies comfortably on mommy's belly
and does some stretches
Sometimes she uses mommy's arm as pillow
and sleeps with her arms and legs spread apart
Her tiny arms and legs twitch from time to time in her sleep
Yuan Zai also likes to wriggle in mommy's arms
to search for the perfect sleeping spot
After a few days of practice
Yuan Yuan has gone from a nervous first-time mom
into a collected mother!

title: 世上只有媽媽好 The Best Mom (English Subtitle Available)

comments.author: 池光玲

comments.text:
just so everyone's aware, they're in a nursing room, not a "jail" and this 
is not their regular enclosure, i've never been to this zoo but with how 
healthy momma and baby look here I'm going to safely assume they have a 
nice big green outdoor area, its just unhealthy and unsafe for the newborn 
to leave the sterile nursing room just yet
all humane zoos have nursing areas like this, even well known US zoos like 
the san diego zoo, so the baby and mother dont get sick, as she gets older 
they'll start letting her into the normal panda enclosure﻿

comments.author: lisacheng3081

comments.text:
Ms. Ruiz, I'm sorry to hear such racist remarks...

First of all, this video was filmed in Taiwan, a subtropical island, during 
the sweltering summer so the pandas, a species typically thriving at lower 
temperatures, had to stay indoors (they're now having some outdoor fun, 
though)
Btw, have you noticed how cramped the (indoor) panda dens in the U.S. are? 
Please watch the panda cams at Zoo Atlanta or Smithsonian National Zoo 
before commenting on this vid. Thank you!
